definitions.definition: A collection of hard small materials, such as dirt, ground stone, debris from sandblasting or other such grinding, or swarf from metalworking.
definitions.example: The flower beds were white with grit from sand blasting the flagstone walkways.
These cookies seem to have grit from nutshells in them.

definitions.definition: A measure of the relative coarseness of an abrasive material such as sandpaper, the smaller the number the coarser the abrasive.
definitions.example: I need a sheet of 100 grit sandpaper.

definitions.definition: A hard, coarse-grained siliceous sandstone; gritstone. Also, a finer sharp-grained sandstone, e.g., grindstone grit.
Strength of mind; great courage or fearlessness; fortitude.
definitions.example: That kid with the cast on his arm has the grit to play dodgeball.

definitions.definition: Apparently only in grit one's teeth: to clench, particularly in reaction to pain or anger.
definitions.example: He has a sleeping disorder and grits his teeth.

definitions.definition: To give forth a grating sound, like sand under the feet; to grate; to grind.
(usually in the plural) Husked but unground oats.
(usually in the plural) Coarsely ground corn or hominy used as porridge.
